sledgehammer.database.document

Class MongoDocument

  • java.lang.Object
    • sledgehammer.database.document.MongoDocument
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MongoBan, MongoFaction, MongoFactionInvite, MongoFactionMember, MongoFactionRelationship, MongoNodeDocument, MongoPeriodicMessage, MongoUniqueDocument

    public abstract class MongoDocument
extends java.lang.Object
    A class designed to handle common operations of Mongo DBObjects that act as documents in a DBCollection.
    Author:
    Jab

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MongoDocument(MongoCollection collection, java.lang.String fieldId)
      Main constructor.

      abstract java.lang.Object getFieldValue()

      Implemented method that loads the data for the document.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MongoDocument

        public MongoDocument(MongoCollection collection,
                     java.lang.String fieldId)
        Main constructor.
        Parameters:
        collection - The MongoCollection storing the document.
        fieldId - The String identifier for the document.

    • Method Detail

      • addEntry

        public void addEntry(MongoDocumentElement entry)
        Adds a MongoDocumentEntry to the document. This is not automatically handled when the document is loaded because of the concept of sub-classing document entries. This should be handled when loading the document. The entries, however will save if they are added when the document is loaded.
        Parameters:
        entry - The MongoDocumentEntry being added to the document.

      • removeEntry

        public boolean removeEntry(MongoDocumentElement entry)
        Removes a given MongoDocumentEntry from the document.
        Parameters:
        entry - The MongoDocumentEntry to remove.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the document exists and is removed.

      • removeEntry

        public boolean removeEntry(java.lang.String entryName)
        Removes a MongoDocumentEntry from the document with a given String name. This also saves the document.
        Parameters:
        entryName - The String name of the document being removed.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the document exists and is removed.

      • getFieldId

        public java.lang.String getFieldId()
        Returns:
        Returns the String ID of the document to store. This is assigned in the constructor, and is used for the 'upsert' methodology.

      • getCollection

        public MongoCollection getCollection()
        Returns:
        Returns the DBCollection that stores the document if saved.

      • save

        public void save()
        Saves the MongoDocument with a given field to identify the document, if it already exists.

      • saveEntries

        public void saveEntries(com.mongodb.DBObject object)

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Deletes the document from the assigned DBCollection.

      • onLoad

        public abstract void onLoad(com.mongodb.DBObject object)
        Implemented method that loads the data for the document.
        Parameters:
        object - The DBObject to pass that contains the data to handle.

      • onSave

        public abstract void onSave(com.mongodb.DBObject object)
        Implemented method that saves the data from the document to the given DBObject.
        Parameters:
        object - The DBObject to save the data to.

      • getFieldValue

        public abstract java.lang.Object getFieldValue()
        Returns:
        Returns the identification value for the 'upsert' methodology.
